chapter.title: Using the Virtual Host manager with VSphere and ESXi
chapter.para: This chapter guides you through adding an ESXi host to a running &susemgr; server. This will allow your ESXi host and its clients to show up as foreign managed systems located under: Systems Virtual Systems

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: With the release of SUSE Manager 3 you can import virtual foreign host data. You can view all systems connected to a VSphere ESXi host. You may set user and group permissions and access rights within VSphere allowing only specific VSphere objects and resources to be imported to SUSE Manager. These objects and resources will show up as foreign hosts from the systems virtual systems or all navigation bars.

step.para: From the &susemgr; &webui; select Systems and then Virtual Host Managers from the left navigation bar.
From the upper right corner of the Virtual Host Managers page select Add VMware-based Virtual Host Manager.
From the Add a VMware-based Virtual Host Manager page fill in the fields with your ESXi host data and select Add Virtual Host Manager.
To view your new ESXi host and its clients select Systems Virtual Systems .
